title: [BEAM-6241] Add support for aggregates using withQueryFn to MongoDbIO
body:
## Problem Statement

The MongoDbIO lacks the following features which limit its usage, especially for applications that deal with large collections.

* Ability to limit the returned results.
* Ability to use MongoDB's [Aggregations](https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/aggregation/).
* The `BoundedMongoDbReader` `start` method is too complex.
* Lacks support to pass native [Filters](http://mongodb.github.io/mongo-java-driver/3.6/javadoc/com/mongodb/client/model/Filters.html) provided by the MongoDB Java driver.

## Description
This PR addresses all of the above mentioned points. It also introduces the following:

* `FindQueryBuilder`: Should be used to build MongoDB queries similar to `db.collection.find(...)`
* `AggregationQueryBuilder`: Should be used to perform queries using aggregations.

## New Features

### Using limit with find queries

```java
MongoDbIO.read()
    .withUri("mongodb://localhost:" + port)
    .withDatabase(DATABASE)
    .withCollection(COLLECTION)
    .withQueryBuilder(
        FindQueryBuilder.create()
            .withFilters(Filters.eq("scientist", "Einstein"))
            .withLimit(5)));

```


### Using aggregations

```java
List<BsonDocument> aggregates = new ArrayList<BsonDocument>();
    aggregates.add(
        new BsonDocument(
            "$match",
            new BsonDocument("country", new BsonDocument("$eq", new BsonString("England")))));

MongoDbIO.read()
    .withUri("mongodb://localhost:" + port)
    .withDatabase(DATABASE)
    .withCollection(COLLECTION)
    .withQueryBuilder(
        AggregationQueryBuilder.create().withMongoDbPipeline(aggregates)));
```

## Upgrade Guide

This release will result in some `Read` stages to fail. The following examples show how to refactor existing code to the new API.

### Reading with a filter

Before
```java
MongoDbIO.read()
    .withUri("mongodb://localhost:" + port)
    .withDatabase(DATABASE)
    .withCollection(COLLECTION)
    .withFilter("{\"scientist\":\"Einstein\"}"));
```

After
```java
MongoDbIO.read()
    .withUri("mongodb://localhost:" + port)
    .withDatabase(DATABASE)
    .withCollection(COLLECTION)
    .withQueryBuilder(
      FindQueryBuilder.create()
        .withFilters(Filters.eq("scientist", "Einstein"))));
```

### Reading with a filter and projections

Before
```java
MongoDbIO.read()
    .withUri("mongodb://localhost:" + port)
    .withDatabase(DATABASE)
    .withCollection(COLLECTION)
    .withFilter("{\"scientist\":\"Einstein\"}")
    .withProjection("country", "scientist"));
```

After
```java
MongoDbIO.read()
    .withUri("mongodb://localhost:" + port)
    .withDatabase(DATABASE)
    .withCollection(COLLECTION)
    .withQueryBuilder(
        FindQueryBuilder.create()
            .withFilters(Filters.eq("scientist", "Einstein"))
            .withProjection(Arrays.asList(new String[] {"country", "scientist"}))));
```

### Reading with Projection

Before
```java
MongoDbIO.read()
    .withUri("mongodb://localhost:" + port)
    .withDatabase(DATABASE)
    .withCollection(COLLECTION)
    .withProjection("country"));
```

After
```java
MongoDbIO.read()
    .withUri("mongodb://localhost:" + port)
    .withDatabase(DATABASE)
    .withCollection(COLLECTION)
    .withQueryBuilder(
        FindQueryBuilder.create()
            .withProjection(Arrays.asList(new String[] {"country"}))));
```

title: [BEAM-6227] Do not compare recovered state against structural null value
body:
When we store the structural null value in a Flink bag state, we must take into
account that it is serialized by the VoidCoder and will be deserialized as
`null` value. We cannot compare it against the structural null value.

Note that we cannot store null in the first place because Flink does not allow
storing null values in its bag state.

title: Remove Gradle from Jenkins job names
body:
This is an artifact from the build migration from Maven to Gradle.
During migration we were maintaining both build systems, and had Jenkins
jobs for both variants. Now that Maven is gone, there is no need to
specify 'Gradle' in the job name. This makes all the job names a bit
shorter.

title: [BEAM-6235] Upgrade AutoValue to version 1.6.3
body: AutoValue 1.6 has now the annotations in a separate artifact: auto-value-annotations. This allows users to specify the annotations in compile scope and the processor in an annotation processing scope, without leaking the processor to a release binary.

title: [BEAM-6234] Make failOnCheckpointingErrors setting available in FlinkPipelineOptions
body:
The configuration setting failOnCheckpointingErrors [1] is available in Flink to allow engineers to specify whether the job should fail in the event of checkpoint failure.

This should be exposed in FlinkPipelineOptions and FlinkExecutionEnvironments to allow users to configure this.

title: [BEAM-6227] Fix GroupByKey with null values in Flink Runner
body:
This passed through ValidatesRunner in streaming mode because the tests use
Combine.perKey() which uses a CombineFn which doesn't lead to buffering null
values. None of the tests seem to use null vales with an explicit GroupByKey.

title: [BEAM-6179] Fixing bundle estimation when all xs are same
body:
We should simply use average when values in xs are same. A xs with repeated values will cause NAN in the computation.

title: [BEAM-6225] Setup Jenkins Job to Run VR with ExecutableStage
body:
Commit https://github.com/apache/beam/commit/c5cc12b0b2e883807058b8e39f7dd57c2dbdd56a added 2 new categories to label VR tests. R: @youngoli CC: @HuangLED , @huygaa11 
FYI: The [ViewTest](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/71c6de321fb8648146f7bd877f074a0a7617c6e0/sdks/java/core/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/ViewTest.java) is all about sideinputs.

Commit https://github.com/apache/beam/commit/2aa79f2404d79052f9bb42a2ca1dbf22a578025e setup a new Jenkins job to run VR tests with ExecutableStage, excludes all sideinputs, states, and other failed tests. R: @swegner

Also clarify some logging about grpc connections made by the BeamPython worker.

title: [BEAM-6200] Deprecate old HadoopInputFormatIO, move it into new HadoopFormatIO
body:
Following the goal to merge read and write parts of Hadoop Input/Output Format files, we need to move `HadoopInputFormatIO.Read` into `HadoopFormatIO` and deprecate it.

The following things were done in this PR:
- `HadoopInputFormatIO.Read` implementation moved into `HadoopFormatIO`
- `HadoopInputFormatIO` is left only as a public interface, all calls are proxied to `HadoopFormatIO`
- `HadoopInputFormatIO` is deprecated
- Tests from `hadoop-input-format` package are copied to `hadoop-input-format` and adapted accordingly
- Old tests of `hadoop-input-format` are left in place to test old deprecated functionality. 

Most changes are only copying and small refactoring, no new functionality was added.

R: @dmvk R: @timrobertson100 - please, take a look

title: [BEAM-5320] [BEAM-6106] Finish Python 3 porting for testing module
body:
This PR is a follow-up on #7029, which was reverted in #7107 due to a checksum mismatch in the postcommit tests.

I tested the PostCommit in #7239. Relevant output of test:
> 15:19:54 root: INFO: CHECKING HASHES
15:19:54 root: ERROR: NEW HASH: d860e636050c559a16a791aff40d6ad809d4daf0
15:19:54 root: ERROR: OLD HASH: 83789a7c1bca7959dcf23d3bc37e9204e594330f
15:19:54 root: ERROR: CONTENT:
15:19:54 root: ERROR: [(1, 16), (2, 7), (3, 6), (4, 5), (5, 6), (6, 5), (7, 8), (8, 4), (9, 7), (10, 10), (11, 9), (12, 10)]

The mismatch is a result of moving the sorting after the string casting in the hashing function. This leads to different sorting behavior for numbers. When looking at the sorted content in the old and new hashing function, we get:
Old: [(1, 16), (2, 7), (3, 6), (4, 5), (5, 6), (6, 5), (7, 8), (8, 4), (9, 7), (10, 10), (11, 9), (12, 10)]
New: ['(1, 16)', '(10, 10)', '(11, 9)', '(12, 10)', '(2, 7)', '(3, 6)', '(4, 5)', '(5, 6)', '(6, 5)', '(7, 8)', '(8, 4)', '(9, 7)']

When moving the sort call in front of the string casting in the new hashing function, we get the same checksum as the old hashing function. However, this will fail on Python 3 due to `TypeError: unorderable types` when comparing different types.

I have therefore updated the postcommit checksum to reflect the hash function change.

title: More robust FnApi Runner.
body:
* Explicit states in the control channel handler.
* Error checking for bundle registration.
* Dispatch side inputs on URN alone.
* Avoid blocking on input channel for aborted bundles.
* Ensure each message stream gets all logs and state changes.

title: [DONT REVIEW][DRAFT] [BEAM-2928] Create sideinputHandler in ULR
body:
Creates sideinputHandler inside ULR.  The goal of this PR is to finish step 1 in this doc: http://bit.ly/2EbqCKd

One issue remains:
Runner sends back a constant Integer(1), for any SideInput request via state API. Note this part does not completely work yet,  there is error during data transmission with complaints: 

Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Integer cannot be cast to [B
        at org.apache.beam.sdk.coders.ByteArrayCoder.encode(ByteArrayCoder.java:41)
...

I am still looking into how to resolve the coding issue, please suggest anything helpful.

title: [BEAM-6190] Add processing stuck message to Pantheon.

This PR adds an indication visible on the Pantheon page of a streaming Dataflow job to indicate when processing on a worker has become stuck.  Currently exceptions in the workers are clearly visible on the Pantheon landing page but stuck worker messages are only viewable in the worker logs.

title: [BEAM-6201] Data insertion pipeline

title: [BEAM-5723] Changed shadow plugin configuration to avoid relocating g…
body:
…uava's ListenableFuture

This seems to be required because the Cassandra driver uses `ListenableFuture` in it's public API, causing relocation to break `CassandraServiceImpl` since its bytecode expects the relocated class but the driver always returns the original one.

My change was simply to exclude `ListenableFuture` from relocation *and* shadowing.

@jbonofre

title: [BEAM-6097] NemoRunner
body:
This is a PR that adds the documentations for the Nemo Runner on the Beam website, as well as an appropriate profile to the maven artifact `pom.xml` file. At the moment, the Apache Nemo 0.1 release process is in progress, and I'm expecting the release process to be finished by this or next week hopefully. The maven `pom.xml` will be perfectly valid by then. As for now, in order to test the Nemo Runner, it has to be built on the local machine from source (get source from https://github.com/apache/incubator-nemo and run the command `man clean install -DskipTests`) and the version can be specified as `0.1-SNAPSHOT`. I've confirmed that the commands that I've entered in the documents work fine on my machine (Mac OS). I've mostly followed the format of other runners to provide the documentation for Apache Nemo Runner, but please let me know if there are additional changes that has to be made. Thanks!

title: [BEAM-4453] Stop subclassing user POJOs.
body:
Previously we were subclassing user POJO objects in order to create them from a Beam Row. This can cause unexpected behavior: e.g. many equals() implementations check that the class is the same, and and will fail if the rhs is a subclass. In this PR we stop doing this, and instead simply generate the code to create the POJO directly.

As a bonus, this should be a small performance boost, as we no longer use reflection to creat e the object.

title: [BEAM-5419] Add Flink multi-version builds
body:
The PR contains three commits in this order:

## [BEAM-5419] Add Flink multi-version build layout

This enables to build against multiple Flink versions. Each version lives in a
separate project folder and loads the main 'flink_runner.gradle' script. Each
project can configure a custom Flink version and a custom source folder
location. This will allow to do overrides in the future when the source can not
be made compatible across different Flink versions.

## [BEAM-5267] Make source 1.6 compatible

## [BEAM-5267] Add Flink v1.6 target for FlinkRunner

title: [BEAM-6188] Unbouded synthetic source
body:
Provides UnboundedSyntheticSource, some necessary refactoring and enables it in java load tests.

Key points: 
 - watermark is based on next elements prediction. Please see SyntheticWatermark class to find out how.
 - Checkpoints consist of start and end position for a bundle 
 - splitting and delays are applied the same way as in Bounded source

Streaming tests are not stopped automatically (yet). I decided to implement this in a separate contribution.

@pabloem could you take a look?

title: [BEAM-6195] Make ProcessRemoteBundleOperation map PCollectionId into correct Outp…
body:
In ProcessRemoteBundleOperation, the received element from sdk harness will be passed into all following OutputReceivers, which is a wrong assumption. Ideally, received element should be passed into the OutputReceiver that represents the same PCollection, There are 2 major changes to make this happen:
1. When converting an InstructionOutput into an InstructionOutputNode, generate a pcollection id and attach to that node.
2. Construct a pcollectionId -> OutputReceiver map and pass it into ProcessRemoteBundleOperation. When receiving element, pass it to the OutputReceiver which has the same pcollectionId .

R: @lukecwik 
cc: @huygaa11 @rohdesamuel

title: [BEAM-6181] Reporting user counters via MonitoringInfos in Portable Dataflow Runner.
body:
Plumb user metrics through Portable Dataflow Runner. 

Some constants are defined in code that later should be later changed to values defined in [this pr](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/6799).

Code only supports User counters. Other types of counters will be added in another PRs.

Added component level tests. Unittests require more refactoring that will hide the essense of this change.
